channel.title: Getting PHP and Java to Work Together?
channel.description:
I'm looking for some sort of PHP to Java Bridge that allows me to do a lot more website sided. Saving stuff to SQL and then working with saved data, and not live data, is annoying. Anyone have suggestions on how to achieve this? Here's an example of what I'm looking to do..
[i]Site-sided [/i]An administrator can send a command to kick (player)
[i]Server-sided [/i]The server acts as a listener and as soon as it gets the command, do the command.
How can I achieve this? Any suggestions that you guys have for a PHP/Java bridge?

item.title: Getting PHP and Java to Work Together?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

RSCShadow:

It just boils down to making some sort of simple socket server on the Java side and a simple socket client on the PHP side. If you wanted something with structure, you could find a Java HTTP REST server and make local HTTP requests with PHP, but that seems like overkill.

Yeah, I didn’t know it was so simple to do something like this… Managed to make the website and server files in just 1.5kb.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting PHP and Java to Work Together?

item.title: Getting PHP and Java to Work Together?
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

It just boils down to making some sort of simple socket server on the Java side and a simple socket client on the PHP side. If you wanted something with structure, you could find a Java HTTP REST server and make local HTTP requests with PHP, but that seems like overkill.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting PHP and Java to Work Together?

item.title: Getting PHP and Java to Work Together?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:5, topic:544078”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=662957.msg4430672#msg4430672 date=1403105581]

Well you could always use the server to listen for packets coming in from your website then perform actions accordingly

That’s what I’m looking for. Are there any pre-built Java applications/packages or whatever that can help me with that. If you could send me a link or two so I can do some research, that’d be helpful. Thanks!
[/quote]
Okay I found this online http://php-java-bridge.sourceforge.net/pjb/ I don’t know if it’ll be much help though.

It’s really easy to make the application yourself, open a socket in php to send data to a listening socket in java.

Everything you need is here:
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/networking/sockets/
http://uk3.php.net/sockets

If you still can’t work it out, I’ll post a snippet.[/quote]

Alright, awesome. Thanks Ashi.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting PHP and Java to Work Together?

item.title: Getting PHP and Java to Work Together?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:4, topic:544078”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=662957.msg4430664#msg4430664 date=1403102524]
Well you could always use the server to listen for packets coming in from your website then perform actions accordingly
[/quote]

That’s what I’m looking for. Are there any pre-built Java applications/packages or whatever that can help me with that. If you could send me a link or two so I can do some research, that’d be helpful. Thanks![/quote]
Okay I found this online http://php-java-bridge.sourceforge.net/pjb/ I don’t know if it’ll be much help though.

It’s really easy to make the application yourself, open a socket in php to send data to a listening socket in java.

Everything you need is here:
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/networking/sockets/
http://uk3.php.net/sockets

If you still can’t work it out, I’ll post a snippet.

Read full topic
